intro: Isertia pterantha, commonly known as the featherleaf isertia, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
